abstract.text: on a sparse matrix of single-precision, floating-point values.

inlineContent.text: Use this function to multiply a scalar value by a sparse matrix, then by a dense matrix, and accumulate the result. The following equation is an example of a matrix-matrix multiplication where the first matrix is sparse:

code: /// The values for _X_ in _Y += alpha * AX_.
/// The values for _Y_ in _Y += alpha * AX_.

abstract.text: Make large-scale mathematical computations and image calculations, optimized for high performance and low energy consumption.
A structure that contains a dense matrix of single-precision, floating-point values.
A structure that contains a sparse matrix of single-precision, floating-point values.
on a sparse matrix of single-precision, floating-point values.
on a sparse matrix of double-precision, floating-point values.
on a vector of double-precision, floating-point values.
on a sparse matrix of double-precision, floating-point values.
on a sparse matrix of single-precision, floating-point values.

media-3703072.alt: A mathematical formula that describes the matrix multiplication, Y plus-equals alpha times A X. A four-by-two matrix added to a scalar value multiplied by a four-by-four matrix multiplied by a four-by-two matrix equals a four-by-two matrix.
